content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find a hotel in Paris with a fitness center and a rating of 8 or higher available for a 5-night stay starting from May 14, 2026, and sort the results by best reviewed.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is a sign-in popup blocking the main booking search page. To proceed with searching for hotels, I need to dismiss this sign-in popup.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.05
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To begin the search for hotels in Paris, I need to enter "Paris" as the destination in the "Where are you going?" input box.
Action: Type [14]; Paris
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.10
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to select the check-in and check-out dates for a 5-night stay starting from May 14, 2026. The current calendar shows September and October 2025. I need to scroll forward to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still need to move forward in the calendar to reach May 2026 for the required check-in date. The "Next month" button is available.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.17
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still not at May 2026 in the calendar, and need to continue moving forward month by month to reach the correct date range.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have only reached January 2026 in the calendar. I still need to move forward several more months to reach May 2026 for the check-in date.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.19
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current months displayed are January 2026 and February 2026. I need to continue going forward in the calendar to reach May 2026 for the required check-in and check-out dates.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.20
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The months displayed are February 2026 and March 2026. I still need to advance further to reach May 2026. The "Next month" button will let me go forward.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The displayed calendar months are now March 2026 and April 2026. I still need to progress forward to May 2026 to select the correct check-in date.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.24
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays May 2026. I can select the check-in date (May 14, 2026) and, for a 5-night stay, the check-out date will be May 19, 2026.
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.30
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in date is now set to May 14, 2026. For a 5-night stay, the check-out date should be May 19, 2026. I need to select May 19 (element [78]) as the check-out date.
Action: Click [78]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.40
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for hotels in Paris from May 14–19, 2026, is set. Next, I need to apply filters: a fitness center and a rating of 8 or higher. "Very Good: 8+" is visible as a filter (element [34]). I'll apply this rating filter first.
Action: Click [34]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Very Good: 8+" rating filter is applied. Now, I need to find and apply the filter for hotels with a fitness center. I should look for a "Fitness center" checkbox under the left sidebar filter options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.60
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The sidebar offers filters like parking and swimming pool, but I do not yet see a "Fitness center" filter. I should continue scrolling to look for the "Fitness center" option.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Fitness center" filter is now visible in the sidebar (element [43]). I need to apply this filter to refine the results to hotels with a fitness center.
Action: Click [43]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.75

content:
Thought: The results are now sorted by "Top reviewed". The top hotel displayed meeting all criteria (Paris, fitness center, rating 8+, best reviewed, correct dates) is "Hôtel des Arts Montmartre" with a rating of 9.6 (Exceptional, 3,221 reviews). The task is complete and ready to provide the full answer.
Action: ANSWER; The best-reviewed hotel in Paris available for a 5-night stay starting from May 14, 2026, with a fitness center and a rating of 8 or higher is "Hôtel des Arts Montmartre" (18th arr., Paris). It has an exceptional rating of 9.6 based on 3,221 reviews.
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 1.0
